AudioProcessingEvent.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The AudioProcessingEvent interface of the Web Audio API represents events that occur when a input buffer is ready to be processed.

remarks.para: An audioprocess event with this interface is fired on a when audio processing is required. During audio processing, the input buffer is read and processed to produce output audio data, which is then written to the output buffer.

blockquote.para: This feature has been deprecated and should be replaced by an AudioWorklet.

AudioProcessingEventAudioProcessingEvent.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The AudioProcessingEvent() constructor creates a new object.

blockquote.para: Usually, this constructor is not directly called by your code, as the browser creates these objects itself and provides them to the event handler.

AudioProcessingEventInputBuffer.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The inputBuffer read-only property of the interface represents the input buffer of an audio processing event.

remarks.para: The input buffer is represented by an object, which contains a collection of audio channels, each of which is an array of floating-point values representing the audio signal waveform encoded as a series of amplitudes. The number of channels and the length of each channel are determined by the channel count and buffer size properties of the AudioBuffer.

AudioProcessingEventOutputBuffer.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The outputBuffer read-only property of the interface represents the output buffer of an audio processing event.

remarks.para: The output buffer is represented by an object, which contains a collection of audio channels, each of which is an array of floating-point values representing the audio signal waveform encoded as a series of amplitudes. The number of channels and the length of each channel are determined by the channel count and buffer size properties of the AudioBuffer.

AudioProcessingEventPlaybackTime.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The playbackTime read-only property of the interface represents the time when the audio will be played. It is in the same coordinate system as the time used by the .
AudioProcessingEventPlaybackTime.value: A number that doesn't need to be an integer.
